title: Language Coverage
content:
**[Indices](http://web.archive.org/web/20131013173516/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Indices) : [Technical Info](http://web.archive.org/web/20131013173516/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Technical%20Info) : Language Coverage**

This article is designed to list which languages are supported by corresponding [Unicode](http://web.archive.org/web/20131013173516/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Unicode) blocks. The rule used here to list languages is to list under scripts that have either official status or are still in popular usage, ie. Azerbaijani officially uses the [Latin](http://web.archive.org/web/20131013173516/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Latin) script, but many Azerbaijanis still use [Cyrillic](http://web.archive.org/web/20131013173516/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Cyrillic) extensively.

**Notes:**  
\* Also requires Latin-1.  
\*\* Also require Greek.  
† Also require Latin-1 & Greek.  
‡ Also require Cyrillic.  
¶ Also require IPA.  
§ Also require Cyrillic Extended-B.  
¨ Also require Hiragana & Katakana.
